prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three blicks:
1. box truck
2. motorcycle
3. tractor

Now pick out the other blicks from the following list:
1. school bus
2. pumpkin
3. bear
4. cat
5. Labrador
6. carrot
7. green bell pepper
8. onion
9. bee
10. box truck
11. crane
12. car
13. yellow bell pepper
14. chiller truck
15. Dalmatian
16. basset hound
17. seal
18. eggplant
19. full-trailer truck
20. red bell pepper
21. loader


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. terrier and toucan
2. box truck and onion
3. loader and yellow bell pepper
4. cat and loader
5. bear and box truck
6. potato and loader
7. full-trailer truck and onion
8. eggplant and bee
9. cat and box truck
10. loader and car
11. semi-trailer truck and onion
12. school bus and red bell pepper
13. cat and school bus
14. pumpkin and box truck
15. box truck and Dalmatian
16. car and crane
17. motorcycle and pig
18. mutt and Labrador
19. carrot and box truck
20. school bus and motorcycle
21. green bell pepper and full-trailer truck
22. eggplant and semi-trailer truck
23. cat and pumpkin
24. seal and motorcycle
25. potato and box truck
26. cat and bear
27. car and box truck
28. eggplant and pumpkin
29. seal and loader
30. tractor and basset hound
31. loader and pig
32. school bus and Dalmatian
33. seal and red bell pepper
34. chiller truck and semi-trailer truck
35. semi-trailer truck and pumpkin
36. bee and toucan
37. bear and Dalmatian
38. car and school bus
39. pig and toucan
40. pumpkin and basset hound
41. green bell pepper and tractor
42. loader and toucan
43. green bell pepper and bee
44. green bell pepper and car
45. mutt and crane
46. eggplant and full-trailer truck
47. chiller truck and tractor
48. crane and Dalmatian
49. loader and crane
50. Dalmatian and toucan


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.

results.choice_explanation: Based on the examples, it appears that 'blicks' refer to vehicles or machinery. Thus, choices are made based on this understanding.
